results.title: The Breakthrough series
results.brief_description: An award winning series of eight films, aimed at adolescents, dealing with violence, stress, divorce, step-parents, death, racism, conflict and political action. The issues are presented in an entertaining and direct manner, hopefully leading to empowerment rather than a feeling of hopelessness.

results.title: The Breaking of the drought
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reel Australia”.
When the outback station of Wallaby is gripped by drought, the proud old owner, Jo Galloway, can do nothing to prevent the repossession of his land by the bank. In poverty, he moves to the city with his wife and daughter, to stay with his son Gilbert, only to learn that Gilbert has been embezzling the family funds to lead a life of luxury and decadence. Many melodramatic events follow, including a murder and a suicide, before the family can return, reunited, to the station, and the rain starts to fall once more.

results.title: The Breakfast club
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ned Tanen and John Hughes
results.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and directed this film which was to become the quintessential high school drama of the 80s. Claire, the princess; Andrew, the jock; John, the criminal; Brian, the nerdy brain; and Alison, the basket case are all faced with spending nine hours together in Saturday detention. They begin the day as strangers having nothing in common, but as the day progresses, they slowly develop a bond in recognising that they are not as different as their places in the high school caste system would have them believe. Cast includes: Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, Anthony Michael Hall, Ally Sheedy and Paul Gleason.

results.title: The Break with tradition
results.creator_credit: Eve Cotton, Center for Humanities and Leslie Ann Nathan
results.brief_description: This program introduces viewers to the origins of modern art - a change from art representing reality to art for art’s sake. It explains one of the most revolutionary aspects of impressionist painting - the use of colour - as seen in the works of Monet, Pissarro and Renoir.

results.title: The brasses
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains the contribution of the brass section in bands and orchestras. Explains the principle of sound production in the brass instruments. Includes demonstrations of the trumpet, cornet, french horn, trombone, baritone and tuba.

group.title: Instruments of the band and orchestra

results.title: The Brass choir: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: A fine and artfully “composed” documentary film of the orchestra in performance. Shows a sensitive demonstration of the tone color of instruments from the orchestra’s brass section with excerpts from Beethoven’s 5th Symphony, the Nocturne from Mendelson’s Midsummer Night’s Dream, Wagner’s Tannhauser.

results.title: The Brain that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Rex Carlton Productions, Mort Landberg, Rex Carlton and Joseph Green
results.brief_description: After a car crash, a man keeps his wife’s head alive in his laboratory. As if this weren’t enough, an evil beast pounds and screams from a locked room adjacent to the lab, for some reason the film ends with the title “The Head that Wouldn’t Die” instead of “The Brain that Wouldn’t Die.” Cast includes Jason Evers (Dr. Bill Cortner, as Herb Evers), Virginia Leith (Jan Compton), Leslie Daniels (Kurt), Adele Lamont (Doris Powell), Bonnie Sharie (Blonde Stripper), Paula Maurice (Brunette Stripper), Marilyn Hanold (Peggy Howard) and Bruce Brighton (Dr. Cortner).

results.title: The Brain Puzzle (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.
results.description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.
